Package exception

package exception
The exception package contains custom exceptions for the Jackaroo game. These exceptions provide specific error handling for invalid actions and selections during gameplay, enhancing the robustness and reliability of the game engine.

Key exception classes in this package:

  • invalid reference 
    exception.GameException
    - The base class for all custom exceptions in the game.
  • invalid reference 
    exception.InvalidSelectionException
    - Abstract class for exceptions related to invalid selections.
  • invalid reference 
    exception.InvalidCardException
    - Thrown when a selected card is invalid for the current game state.
  • invalid reference 
    exception.InvalidMarbleException
    - Indicates that a selected marble is not allowed for the intended action.
  • invalid reference 
    exception.SplitOutOfRangeException
    - Raised when a split distance selection is outside the valid range.
  • invalid reference 
    exception.ActionException
    - Abstract class for exceptions related to illegal gameplay actions.
  • invalid reference 
    exception.IllegalMovementException
    - Thrown when an invalid marble movement is attempted.
  • invalid reference 
    exception.IllegalSwapException
    - Indicates an invalid attempt to swap marbles on the board.
  • invalid reference 
    exception.IllegalDestroyException
    - Raised when an action would wrongly return a marble to the Home Zone.
  • invalid reference 
    exception.CannotFieldException
    - Thrown when a marble cannot be legally placed on the board.
  • invalid reference 
    exception.CannotDiscardException
    - Thrown when a card cannot be discarded under current game rules.

Example Usage:


 try {
     gameManager.makeMove(player, move);
 } catch (InvalidMoveException e) {
     System.out.println("Invalid move: " + e.getMessage());
 } catch (InvalidCardException e) {
     System.out.println("Invalid card selection: " + e.getMessage());
 }

By using custom exceptions, the Jackaroo game achieves improved error tracking, debugging, and robust input validation.
